It has taken about a year to finally get everything together (mainly the pa=
rticipants), but the Samurai Archives podcast is now on the air.

The first=
 two episodes are available, and were recorded at the Association of Asian =
Studies conference in Honolulu, Hawaii, and detailed some of the seminars. =
The 3rd episode will be coming up next week, and will be a convention wrap =
up.  After the conference series is done, the actual official podcast forma=
t will start, with each episode being between 45 minutes and an hour, and w=
ill examine different aspects of Japanese history. This will probably start=
 next month, and new episodes should be released every 3-4 weeks, if not mo=
re frequently.

Samurai Archives podcast website:  http://samuraiarchives.p=
odbean.com/

Subscribe on Itunes: http://bit.ly/i1FIzT

The first two episo=
des were recorded on location, and edited with free audio software, so the =
sound quality is to be expected - not great, but hardware and software is b=
eing updated, so within the next month or two the sound quality should dram=
atically increase.

We look forward to feedback, and once the actual podcas=
t kicks off next month, we look forward to participation, questions, feedba=
ck, requests for future episodes, etc.

Enjoy!
